required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Observational Study With Mode of Action-Analysis of Cystorenal Cranberry Extract in Patients With Recurrent Urinary Tract Infections
clinical_study.official_title: Observational Study With Mode of Action-Analysis of Cystorenal Cranberry Extract in Patients With Recurrent Urinary Tract Infections

brief_summary.textblock: The main focus of this observational study is to analyze the possible effects of cranberry dietary supplements on the intestinal microbiota in women with recurrent uncomplicated urinary tract infections. In a secondary analysis the possible influence of the microbiota changes on the recurrence frequency in the follow-up should be analyzed.

primary_outcome.time_frame: In the 6-month prospective observation period compared to a 6-month retrospective period

other_outcome.measure: Stool analysis: Intestinal microbiome by sequencing 16S rRNA

intervention.description: 3 x Cystorenal Cranberry plus daily for 6 months (contains 300 mg Cranberry-Extract, 100 mg Pumpkin seeds-Extract, 20 mg Vitamin C und 0,47 mg Riboflavin)

study_pop.textblock: Patients with chronic recurrent Urinary Tract Infections

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
• chronic recurrent urinary tract infections (≥3 infections per year or 2 infections in the last 6 months)
Exclusion Criteria:
- renal insufficiency (GFR <60),
- anatomical or known structural causes of urinary tract infections
- regular consumption of probiotics or probiotic yogurts (at least 5x / week)
- intake of antibiotics in the last 4 weeks
- intake of Marcumar
- simultaneous participation in another study

facility.name: Charité Hochschulambulanz für Naturheilkunde am Immanuel Krankenhaus
